Santa_Barbara.Skofield Park:
Skofield Park is a 35 acres (140,000 m2) natural open space preserve and city park located within Santa Barbara, California.  Rattlesnake Canyon Park is located nearby, with both in the "front country" of the Santa Ynez Mountains.


== History ==
The land was formerly owned by Ray Skofield, and originally used as a camp for "Los Rancheros Vistadores," a men's riding group which Skofield was a founder of in 1930.
